noun.description: Chiefly in Italy or in Italian-speaking contexts: a picture, especially a portrait. Also (and in earliest use) figurative.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in James Mabbe (d. ?1642), translator. From Italian ritratto picture representing the human form, use as noun of past participle of ritrarre to retract, to withdraw, to draw, paint from classical Latin retrahere.
